title: Biochemical Molecular Structure-Function Relationships: Blended Learning Utilizing 3D Printed Models

context.prior_knowledge: Basic biochemistry concepts and familiarity with fundamental molecular biology terminology
context.additional_context: Work-integrated education courses for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields. Blended online-offline classroom environments using digital devices (laptops/tablets)

learning_goals: Learners explain structural features of DNA/RNA with 80% accuracy by manipulating 3D-printed molecular models.
Learners analyze structure-function relationships case-by-case through transcription factor-protein interaction simulations.
Learners explain biochemical transformation processes in three or more logical steps using DNA supercoiling dynamics models.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
